feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 1:53PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf From The Bering Strait to Point Hope Through Monday... Northwest winds of 15 to 30 mph are expected to develop tonight over the southern Chukchi Sea continue into Monday. This will cause elevated surf with minor beach erosion along the coast from the Bering Strait to Point Hope.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 4:18AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ..Elevated Surf From Cape Lisburne to Point Barrow Through Monday Night... Southwest winds of 20 to 30 mph blowing over the Arctic Coast from Cape Lisburne to Point Barrow are causing elevated surf. These winds will continue into Monday, then turn northwest Monday afternoon, and decrease Monday night. These winds are causing
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 12 at 5:25PM CDT until August 14 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...High waves and dangerous currents are expected as waves build up to 3 to 6 feet. * WHERE...Beaches along Lake Michigan in Door, Kewaunee and Manitowoc Counties.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 12 at 2:57PM CDT until August 14 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Life threatening waves of 3 to 5 feet and dangerous currents are expected. * WHERE...Beaches along Lake Michigan in Sheboygan, and Ozaukee counties.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 5:26PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Natrona and east central Fremont Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 525 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles northeast of Jeffrey City, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 12 at 5:03PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, Hot Springs. * WHEN...Until 800 PM MDT.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 4:55PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Albany County through 545 PM MDT... At 455 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bosler, or 19 miles north of Laramie, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected along portions of Kirby Creek in far Southeast Hot Springs County. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, Hot Springs. * WHEN...Until 700 PM MDT.
